alert.note: Alert for Shoshone (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 03 at 11:39AM MDT until May 07 at 10:48PM MDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Spokane WA has issued a Flood Watch for the following rivers in Washington... Stehekin River at Stehekin affecting Chelan County. ...The Flood Watch is extended for the following rivers in Idaho... Washington... Coeur d Alene River at Cataldo affecting Shoshone and Kootenai Counties. Kettle River near Ferry above Curlew affecting Ferry County. St Joe River at St Maries affecting Benewah County. St Joe River at Calder affecting Shoshone County. For the Kettle River...including Ferry above Curlew...flooding is possible. ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON TO LATE SUNDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...St Joe River at Calder. * WHEN...From Friday afternoon to late Sunday evening. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Bear Creek will begin to back up from the St Joe River and may start to spill into the town of Calder, flooding the low spots in yards, roads and parking lots. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 AM PDT Wednesday the stage was 12.5 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached early Friday afternoon and is expected to crest Saturday morning. A gradual receding will take place Sunday through late weekend below flood stage. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (11 am PDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat St Joe River Calder 13.0 12.5 Wed 9 am PDT 12.5 12.9 13.5 &&
info.instruction: Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings. If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Thursday morning at 1100 AM PDT.
